title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 1107.9 - Ethics and standards of professional practice for continuing education
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 1107.9 - Ethics and standards of professional practice for continuing education

State Regulations
(a) To renew a
license or certification expiring on or after January 1, 2004, the licensed or
certified real estate appraiser or licensed real estate appraiser assistant
must have completed the seven-hour National USPAP update course or its
equivalent during the two-year license period prior to renewal. A course is
equivalent to the seven-hour National USPAP update course only if the course
has been certified as equivalent by the Appraisal Qualification Board of the

Appraisal Foundation. (b) Continuing education credit shall be granted for the completion of the
seven-hour National USPAP update course or its equivalent only if the course is
taught by an instructor who has been certified as a certified USPAP instructor
by the Appraisal Qualification Board of the Appraisal Foundation and who is, in
addition, either a certified residential real estate appraiser or a certified
general real estate appraiser. For the purposes of this subdivision, an
instructor may be a certified real estate appraiser in New York or any other
state. Notes

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
